messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Anybody speak "Yahoo"?
messages.msgSnippet: The + and - amounts are relative to GMT.  This is not something Yahoo does but something each mailer program does. Since you, in Germany, are +0200, I d assume
messages.messageBody:
The + and - amounts are relative to GMT. This is not something Yahoo
does but something each mailer program does.
Since you, in Germany, are +0200, I'd assume that GMT does not switch to
Daylight Savings Time as most of Europe and North America do!

There is a lot of information in a full mail header - we see only a
portion of it usually.

Cindy


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Alan & Brenda Leonard [mailto:abtleo@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 11, 2002 3:49 AM
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Anybody speak "Yahoo"?
>
>
> I'm curious about something. These are message headers from
> digest, sans messages. I'm interested in the time/date
> stamps. Are the -0500 -0400 times indicating the hours away
> from another time zone? But then I end up wondering why Pam,
> in California comes out as EDT (which I'm certain does not
> include CA!), and I come out as +0200, when I know that (in
> Germany) I'm 6 hours ahead of EDT.
>
> It's not earthshattering, but hey, I was interested!
>
> brenda
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Anybody speak "Yahoo"?
messages.msgSnippet: ... No, it make you look like an early riser like me :-) Joyce
messages.messageBody:
on 7/11/02 9:58 AM, SandraDodd@... at SandraDodd@... wrote:

> I know if I'm up til 2:00 in Mountain time it looks like I
> was up til 4:00 on the e-mail<g>.

No, it make you look like an early riser like me :-)

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Anybody speak "Yahoo"?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/11/02 5:37:18 AM, abtleo@earthlink.net writes:  I think AOL
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/11/02 5:37:18 AM, abtleo@... writes:

<< But then I end up
wondering why Pam, in California comes out as EDT >>

I think AOL timestamps everybody Eastern time because that's where the
computers are. I know if I'm up til 2:00 in Mountain time it looks like I
was up til 4:00 on the e-mail<g>.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Anybody speak "Yahoo"?
messages.msgSnippet: I m curious about something.  These are message headers from digest, sans messages.  I m interested in the time/date stamps.  Are the -0500 -0400 times
messages.messageBody:
I'm curious about something. These are message headers from digest, sans
messages. I'm interested in the time/date stamps. Are the -0500 -0400
times indicating the hours away from another time zone? But then I end up
wondering why Pam, in California comes out as EDT (which I'm certain does
not include CA!), and I come out as +0200, when I know that (in Germany) I'm
6 hours ahead of EDT.

It's not earthshattering, but hey, I was interested!

brenda
